results.title: Army ants: a study in social behaviour
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
This film depicts two species of army ants in the Panama Canal zone. It presents the basic structure of an ant colony and the behaviour of the ants and shows evidence of stimuli which influence their behaviour. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.brief_description: A survey of the training of Army personnel in aviation, parachute jumping and various other forms of air training. No other credits available.

results.title: Arms race: where do we stand?
results.brief_description: Presented by Richard Morecroft, this thought-provoking program examines the important social issue of the arms race. Covers such topics as: the Maralinga tests, NATO and the Warsaw Pact, nuclear stockpiles, Australia’s defence forces policy, costs of war and the peace movement.

results.title: Armidale: provincial city
results.brief_description: Armidale is 300 miles north of Sydney in a district called New England. The film shows how the city owes its prosperity to the land, and includes a sequence on the University of New England.

results.title: Armageddon
results.creator_credit: Michael Bay, Jerry Bruckheimer and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Big budget sci-fiction thriller from director Michael Bay is nothing less than a glorious onslaught of thrills, explosions and entirely employable, if increasingly unlikely, scenarios. Negative reviews (deriding its extravagance and silliness) did nothing to dent its box office haul. Cast includes Bruce Willis, Billy Bob Thornton, Liv Tyler, Ben Affleck, Will Patton, Owen Wilson, Steve Buscemi, Owen Wilson, Peter Stormare.

results.title: Arlington Road
results.creator_credit: Mark Pellington, Peter Samuelson, Lakeshore Entertainment, Marc Samuelson and Tom Gorai
results.brief_description: After his FBI agent wife is killed by an extremist group, college professor Michael Faraday moves his son and himself to a new neighborhood, to make a fresh start. Driving home from work one day he saves the life of a boy, the son of his neighbours Oliver and Cheryl Lang. Becoming friends with the Langs’, Michael’s life begins to improve, he has a new girlfriend, his son is happy, and he has a job teaching American History at the local college - specialising in terrorism and extremist activities. Soon he begins to notice details of Oliver’s stories don’t add up. Are his neighbours as normal as they seem? Cast includes Jeff Bridges, Tim Robbins and Joan Cusack.

results.title: Arkady Leokum's Tell Me Why
results.brief_description: Based on the best selling book series by Arkady Leokum this series of videos answers questions that children commonly ask on a wide variety of subjects. Colourful graphics and exciting film footage combined with quick search numbers on screen make this an easy to use and fun learning tool.

group_works.title: Life forms, animals and animal oddities

results.title: Ark of Gondwana: Victoria's rainforest heritage
results.creator_credit: Brendan Lavelle, Marion Crooke and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Rainforests are among the Earth’s most ancient and diverse natural communities. They are very fragile habitats. In Victoria, rainforests are limited to scattered patches because of previous climatic conditions and the impact of European settlement. The video examines the rainforest theme in three segments: The Living Ark: looks at the ancient link between Australia’s rainforests and those in other parts of the world and gives an introduction to life in a rainforest. Rainforest Odyssey: examines the types of rainforest in Victoria and their distribution. A Fragile Heritage: looks at the importance of Victoria’s rainforests and factors that threaten their survival.

results.title: Arizona dream
results.creator_credit: Emir Kusturica, Claudie Ossard, Yves Marmion, Hachette Premiere, Constellation, Canal+ and CNC
results.brief_description:
Serbian born director Emir Kusturica’s first English language film is an absurdist comedy that focuses on the quirks of small town U.S. culture. Kusturica grafts his sometimes unwieldy Europe-inflected concerns onto brash American landscapes with mixed results. Johnny Depp stars as Axel, a young drifter caught between the dreams of youth and the responsibilities of adulthood. Enticed back to his Arizona hometown, the oddball residents take more than a passing interest in him. While his uncle Leo tries to convince him to take over the family’s cadillac dealership, Axel becomes caught up in a love triangle with a wealthy widow and her stepdaughter.
Cast also includes: Jerry Lewis, Faye Dunaway, Lili Taylor and Vincent Gallo.

results.title: Aristotle and the scientific method
results.brief_description: An analysis of Aristotle’s contribution to the development of scientific method. Departing from Plato’s ideas, Aristotle made observations based on his experience, classified his data, performed experiments and sought to arrive at generalizations or principles. Also examines how his work laid the foundation for such sciences as botany and zoology. No other credits available.
